newsitem.title: CHINA: China January RPI up 3.3 percent yr/yr - TV.
newsitem.headline: China January RPI up 3.3 percent yr/yr - TV.

text.p: China's retail price inflation rose 3.3 percent year-on-year in January, state television said on Monday quoting the State Statistical Bureau.
Retail price inflation in January was up by 0.7 percent compared with December 1996, the bureau said.
"Prices of staple foods and industrial products were stable," it said.
"But in some areas, the rate of increase was too high... and we must increase controls on prices," it said.
China's retail price inflation was 6.1 percent in 1996, down from 14.8 percent in 1995 and from a communist-era high of 21.7 percent in 1994.
